availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Andrew Galbraith Kyle (Mercer County, Kentucky, farmer; president of Harrodsburg Savings Institution)

body.p: Mercer County, Kentucky, farmer and president of Harrodsburg Savings Institution. Washington County, Kentucky native. Son of Thomas Kyle. Married to Jane H. Glover. Father of John G. Kyle and Thomas Kyle. Justice of the Peace in Mercer County in 1847. Chairman of meeting of the friends of emancipation and colonization in Mercer County in April 1849. Commissioner of the Harrodsburg Savings Institution in 1850. Commissioner of Lexington, Harrodsburg, and Bowling Green Railroad Company in 1851. Farmer in Mercer County in 1850. Farmer in Mercer County in 1860. President of the Harrodsburg Savings Institution in 1864. Colonel in state militia. Owned fourteen enslaved persons in 1850. Owned eighteen enslaved persons in 1860.

Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Mercer County, District No. 2., p. 907-8.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mercer County, Harrodsburg, p.715.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Mercer County, Harrodsburg, p. 7-8.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mercer County, Harrodsburg, p. 583B.
Mercer, Will Books, 1865, 1916_, Mercer County, October 19, 1871, p. 127 (Accessed via Ancestry.com).
Thomas Kyle, death certificate, Kentucky Death Records, 1852-1964 Microfilm # 7016150, Mercer County, January 31, 1913 (Accessed via Ancestry.com).
Taliaferro P. Shaffner, ed., _ The Kentucky State Register, for the Year 1847_ (Louisville: Morton & Griswold, 1847), 132.
"Public Meeting in Mercer," The Louisville Daily Courier (Louisville, Ky.), April 19, 1849, p. 2.

Acts of the General Assembly of the Commonwealth of Kentucky: Passed at the November Session, 1850, vol. 2 (Frankfort: A. G. Hodges & Co., State Printers, 1850), 561.
Thomas W. Westerfield, ed., Kentucky Genealogy and Biography: Sketches from Adair, Boyle, Casey, Cumberland, Garrard, Green, Lincoln, Madison, Marion, Mercer, Nelson, Taylor, Washington Counties, vol. 5 (Owensboro, Ky.: Genealogical Reference Company, 1975), p. 173. Reprint of W. H. Perrin, J. H. Battle, and G. C. Kniffin, Kentucky: A History of the State, 4th ed.
